title: Reporting GGEZ
body:
Yes it is an offence and yes I will be reporting you.

Whether you consider it harmless trash talk or not, at the very least it is unsportsmanlike like behaviour and obnoxious to the other team (as intended).

Riot also stated in the past it is a breach of summoner code,   Though I'm not sure how many people get punished for this.

I was wondering how many  of you also report the other side for this behaviour ?

replies.body:
Good on you for reporting what you feel is unsportsmanlike conduct. I also really hate gg ez statements after a game. Especially THE WORST kind which is when its a 50 minute slug fest. The hardest. Closest. Game. Ever. and then the worst player on the enemy teams just like gg ez. its so infuriating haha. 

We need to build a sportsmanlike community together and one part of that is speaking up when players are being unsportsmanlike. 

@Lord Sesshomaru I don't think a player would get permanently banned for saying GG EZ once. 

But if they get a 10 game chat restriction cause multiple players have said its unsportsmanlike, then continued to say ggez and got a 25 game chat restriction cause more players said it was unsportsmanlike THEN continued to say GGEZ and got a 2 week ban THEN continued to say GG EZ after that....I guess they might get permanently banned.

Well what if the only thing they said was GG EZ? Would It still be okay to report? Tbh this is a problem I've always had, if someone says one toxic thing is that alone enough to issue a report? Would that lessen the strength of my reports? Would really appreciate an answer to this as It's plagued my thoughts with wondering for a while ):

It's up to each individual player to determine what is and isn't okay in our community. A lot of players dislike "GG EZ" because it comes across as dickish and unsportsmanlike and they report because of that. The standards of our game are determined by what you think is and isn't okay. If you personally don't think that players behaviour in that game warrants a report then don't report. But if you do feel like their behaviour was inappropriate then please do report.

I highly doubt someone that only says ggez after one game will receive any severe punishment. But if players continue to say its not okay by reporting him and he continues to get penalized but still continues to behave the same way his punishments will escalate.
Thanks for that :O I will continue to report these bad mannered critters who say ggez :D

Yeah but being a total cock burger and saying GGEZ at the end of the game every game is really childish and yeah you kind of do deserve a ban if after MULTIPLE times being banned or chat restricted you kept it up and then finally got the permaban you really do deserve it. 

Read the summoners code man. It clearly states what is toxic behavior.
Yeah man it tilts me to no ends when people say GG EZ

Yeah the worst thing about it isn't that it tilts you for THAT game but for the game after it. So not only do you lose, you get angry and tilt for the next game and possibly can be salty to your own team mates who did nothing wrong.

You make me love you with every post you make. I agree with everything you say here and certainly the end. 

I am not sure if i have yet received a ban ever restriction or otherwise.. and i know i can get pretty rowdy at times in chat but if i ever did like what you said and still didn't get the picture, go for it perma ban my close to 1000$ RP account right now. I hope i never become that toxic in game!

Toxic as in consistently doing the same annoying things to people over and over again is a problem. If they don't get the message they deserve to be banned. Wanna know who doesn't deserve to be banned? People who say ggez.

I am going to upvote the post and Maraudaur's comment so the other side of this gets up there, but your views of the community are severely warped.

Warped? no. 

Your veiw on this is warped more. You know this is toxic behavior you even see a red post about it saying the same thing.

GGEZ once wont get you a perm ban, just read Mara's post, but constantly doing it and knowing it pisses off other players you MIGHT have to play with one day. Is stupid. 

It is one of the things that keeps that never ending cycle alive where people get trolled, only to get annoyed, play another game while annoyed, and yell at others then making them annoyed to the point where they end up being one of the trolls who says "GGEZ" at the end of games. Monkey see, monkey do. Thing is we are humans not really monkeys, so we know how to and when to stop that and we should. Humans have the capacity to change and we have done so over the history of man and civilization, i mean for instance we don't kill deformed or handicapped babies/children anymore. 

So saying that there is another side to the GGEZ thing is rather silly as there SHOULDN'T be another side, because that side is known to be toxic and unsportsmanlike. We don't need that unsportsman behavior anymore or at all. Banter during the match is okay, fine, say "gotcha" or some other thing, that isn't really that toxic. But doing poorly then saying nothing but GGEZ at the end of the match isn't banter, that is just out right being a troll. 
Example, you are out on the town and you meet a girl, she says she is 18, it turns out she is 15. You say oh fuck, and don't do it again. But if you keep doing it, over and over, seeking out that aged women then sure of course in the end you will get in trouble. So why keep doing it? Rules are in place for a reason. This game has an no toxicity/trolling rule, so why not abide by that rule?

I never report someone for banter, even if i am salty or upset. I just live with it. But people who say EZ or GGEZ are just children. This is the reason people hate the yas or riven player thing, they just know they are a certain way or are most likely a troll. 


I mean sure.. if the enemy is being a total dick.. you kind of have the right to say GGEZ at the end kind of like a poke in the eye. But constantly every game saying it you deserve the warning or chat ban/perma ban in time. You can't fight that reasoning.

People who repeatedly say ggez are annoying and whilst I don't get upset from them I guess I agree they get a ban. But you are grouping together those people with people that stomp you and say it as banter or when you barely lost they will say it.

These people don't deserve for you to focus your tilt or anger at them. I don't play in high elo but I am assuming Riot gets their idea of ggez from there. It is considered BM in a competitive environment. If you play league to rank up for have fun you can't get upset over someone saying ggez.

Rules are in place for a reason, that doesn't mean those rules have correct morals behind them. I will never say ggez mostly because I can't be bothered but if I ever do it would most likely be at the end of a game where it was either a complete stomp, when I get stomped, or when we end up barely making a comeback.

I play in low elo which is Bronze to Gold, and no one can take offense from that because they aren't playing in a competitive environment. In another post on this thread I went over how you can report anyone and it could be a re-portable offense but that doesn't change your attitude which is unhealthy.

At the end of the day, sure. Ban these people, they deserve it, blah blah blah. I left my self ambiguous when I said your views on our community are warped. What I should have elaborated is that you judge people from saying ggez and literally get mad at them when what they have done is so minor. Soon you guys will be asking for the dance emote at the nexus to be re-portable because it is BM or has toxic intentions.

These are actual mental issues that need to be explored, people who play video games have been known to commonly have anxiety issues. I sincerely ask you to read my explanation further below.

I don't want to start an argument but to sum up my point, yes this should be reportable if you take offense from it, but why and how do you guys get offended in the first place? This is the internet in 2016, if you can't handle someone saying ggez, you will be eaten alive.

Also, my definition of banter is clearly different to your definition of banter. League of Legends is a multicultural game, with different back grounds and races playing it in each region. I want to censor myself but if someone said "F/// you" or "Nice try dumba//", that is clearly banter to me. People who intend it in a toxic way can get muted and go about their business, but people who infer that it is toxic and report aren't solving anything.

You can sweep up 99% of the people you don't agree with or get mad at but you will still get pissed off by the 1%. I agree that the toxic people are annoying, and I guess reports are a way of dealing with them, but at the same time, please, grow a shell. It is children who get offended by things like this aswell as people who say it. People like this will always be around so while you report them you also need to change yourself and how you feel about them otherwise you will never cope.

Actually you totally contradicted your self there mate. You first say its annoying and they should get a ban for saying it after a match then you say it is okay for them to say it after a close match... Pick one. Is it wrong or okay to say GGEZ at the end of the match when you did jack all for the game. 

Also you have all the right to get upset that some ass is being disrespectful to you,  your team and even their own team by saying GGEZ. Not only does it say "you are a noob" to you, it also says "your team suck and should learn how to play" to your team, then to their own team it says "that wasn't a challenge" which means that HARD battle and game they had for that close victory meant nothing and that it is normal or not even normal, that real matches would be EVEN HARDER which means most likely they lose games dramatically over tight close matches with even skill. How does that not click in your head? Is it you are so oblivious to what the meaning of "ggez" means or do you use it and want to defend the toxic behavior?


> [{quoted}](name=Rengorax,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=clgnxlgw,comment-id=00050001000000000000,timestamp=2016-08-23T09:19:36.243+0000)

In another post on this thread I went over how you can report anyone and it could be a re-portable offense but that doesn't change your attitude which is unhealthy.

Rules are rules man. You can't really see moral behind them other than it is the design the creators have for their product or game. Sure you don't have to 100% follow those rules by all means. But if you go against the rules and don't expect to be punished at one point for not following the rules you are pretty stupid. They are there for a reason as i have already said, so why not abide by those rules?

Also low ELO isn't bronze to gold. Low ELO is Br5 -Gold5. After mid way into gold 4 it is Mid ELO which ends at Plat 5 if i remember correctly. 

To the next part, you can take offense to anything thrown at you, sure you can't impart your will on everything you are offended by, but by all means i will take offense to someone who constantly acts like things are a cake walk when they really did nothing to offer help for their team other than being a punching bag to put abilities on CD so they aren't use on their team. Sure in some sense that is support or helping your team but that doesn't make the game easy for you or the team. Being toxic isn't OFFENDING someone it is just bringing the mood down of one or more parties and causing a domino effect which overall makes the entire community toxic/not nice to be around.

People play for fun, they don't need some idiot bringing down the levels of fun. Sure in ranked you are playing 'for real' but most don't think that way, they think because they are bronze or low ELO they can get away with not caring or just out right being a dick to other human beings. Seriously that is another human you are being rude too. Would you just walk up to a random person and insult them? Would you walk up to someone who is sick and/or dying and tease them for dying or being sick?? Because that is what it is like when you call someone out for having a bad game or losing. 

>At the end of the day, sure. Ban these people, they deserve it, blah blah blah. I left my self ambiguous when I said your views on our community are warped. What I should have elaborated is that you judge people from saying ggez and literally get mad at them when what they have done is so minor. Soon you guys will be asking for the dance emote at the nexus to be re-portable because it is BM or has toxic intentions.

No that is not how it works. Emotes really don't impact the game, you can turn them off or just decrease volume. The only way to stop someone saying GGEZ at the end of the game is to know they are going to say it and mute them before they can. Which is hard because some people actually like to respect their foe and just say GG. Or GG close game. So i shouldn't have to mute everyone just so i don't see it said from my team and the enemy... that is just bad design as it is a MULTIPLAYER GAME, which involves TEAM WORK AND COMMUNICATION. So you take the communication side of the game out.. you just have a very dull game which has no feeling or impact on your self esteem. 

Bannable offences will never escalate. They have been the same for the entire time this game has been around (and i have been playing this for close to 8 years i think, or 7, i started when beta released). And in that time i have not seen it change at all. Other than the menu choices for banning has expanded so it is easier for the support crew to sift through and find the really bad violations first.

So don't think banning for certain things babies the community, it will more relax it and make outsiders stop calling us the most toxic community for gaming. Because it isn't, there are many other games more toxic (COD, Rainbow6 and Squad to name a few). 

>These are actual mental issues that need to be explored, people who play video games have been known to commonly have anxiety issues. I sincerely ask you to read my explanation further below.
>
>I don't want to start an argument but to sum up my point, yes this should be reportable if you take offense from it, but why and how do you guys get offended in the first place? This is the internet in 2016, if you can't handle someone saying ggez, you will be eaten alive.

What are mental issues? You are talking to someone who has a real mental issue and my mental issue is bad and never reflects on me as a person in game/in chat. (I have schizophrenia so yeah my mental illness is rather severe.. see things and hear things and i suffer from anxiety on a pretty large level when my paranoia is high.)

Blaming this on anxiety is a poor excuse. It doesn't give you a valid reason to be a tosser to people online just because you have met one or two tossers in real life who do it doesn't mean you have to reflect that in game. Be you as you are in person in chat, you don't say "fuck you" to a guy who opens a door for you do you? So why do that to others in game. Blaming mental health issues is just silly... 

>Also, my definition of banter is clearly different to your definition of banter. League of Legends is a multicultural game, with different back grounds and races playing it in each region. I want to censor myself but if someone said "F/// you" or "Nice try dumba//", that is clearly banter to me. People who intend it in a toxic way can get muted and go about their business, but people who infer that it is toxic and report aren't solving anything.

The thing is that isn't really banter, that is negative banter. Real banter is "Oh nice try" Or "close one!" Or even cheeky stuff like "thanks for pushing me away trist/name of champ who knocks back or away". Adding things like ass or fuck are just trying to embellish a stereotype or just bad manners. Sure i have probably used swear words in banter but never directed towards the person. As you can see.. adding a swear to banter makes it seem hostile, it is a chat based system for communication not a visual, take tennis for instance, there is a couple famous players who use swearing or gestures which are rude, but only one or two are known for seeming like they are directed with malice. John McEnroe is the one i am mainly talking about, he has a very angry face when he says the stuff he said in matches. So in game it is hard to see our expression, you might be smiling when you say "fuck you" or laughing. But they can't tell unless you add more to the text. Which means more time and thought which most gamers wont or can't do as they are in a fast pace environment and every second matters. 

Watch some pro players. The chat is rather barren, they know every keystroke is important and most the time only will type when dead, at times to try make the enemy player type so they miss things. It is the reason i don't talk as much anymore, i can't tell you how many times typing something got me killed or miss something like CS or the map.

(continue in another post)

I'm not gonna continue this argument, we have a different view and a different social standard and upbringing, just like any community. I haven't contradicted my self and I haven't said these people don't deserve a ban.

I have merely stated my opinion on the mental properties of these occurrences. So thank you for your input but if you want to have an argument you can't down vote my post. Downvoting is when a post is negative and has no helpful use to anything. For example, I upvoted Maraudaur's post even though I don't agree with him so that people can see what he said and the responses including mine. Where as you don't agree with my side of the argument so you down vote it the same way people down vote YouTube videos.

I'm not gonna have a political analysis on the correctness of saying ggez, I already agree repeat offenders can justify a ban. I am saying that you shouldn't be pissed off at them.

And like I said. My banter is different to your banter. My friends and people I meet in game say stuff like that, you might have different standards. But you refuse to accept these differences.

Yeah but the thing is mental illness shouldn't and doesn't come into this really. And you tried to bring it into the discussion (not an argument). I think it is just your grasp on words in general is the problem over our upbringings, because if you think upbringing is the reason i disagree with you, then you are sorely mistaken. 

I use swears all the time, i swear like a sailor. I do have to stop as i work as a nurse and it can be very difficult not to upset the residents or even boss. But it has nothing to do with swearing. I also was raised in a broken home in a very poor neighborhood so is it that you think? No because that would mean i would be like you said. 

My issue is that you think that upbringing, mental health and 'manning' up is the problem with this community other then the fact the real issue is a on going one which involves people perpetuating an attitude instead of acting like a real person would. Sure if they were a bogan in real life then acted like a bogan in game sure of course that would be real to them. But even that needs restraint and they need to learn this is a bigger community full of many different types of people and acting out in any manner deserves some kind of punishment. You just seem to think we should let "boys be boys" so to say and let people get away with being crude and horrible people. 

And i didn't say you don't think ppl should be banned. I am directing more to the fact you say it is okay to say it(ggez), then also not okay to say it, in multiple comments which i can quote my self here as i can see you have wrote it. You can't back peddle on it, and from the fact you are backing down you seem to know you said the wrong thing or things already. You need to 'man up' and take that you said something wrong man.

And yeah banter is different between different people but i think you clearly missed what i said due to some reading problem or something. Or maybe i said it wrong. Nope i read over what i said again, clear as day. What i am saying is some times using swearing in banter can be looked at as an attack as you can't see their face or hear the inflections on their voice. So you don't know it is in jest you can only hope they understand. When most don't. Most people come into a game already a little tilted or pissed off.. they got back from work, or had a fight with someone irl. Then you come along and say "fucking bullshit" or "You fucked up" and in their head due to stress or their mood they add to it, adding words like idiot, or you are bad. The difference between saying to someone "you fucked up" and "oh man you messed up there" is massive, from aggressive to a laugh. 

Seriously why do you think people probably type aggressively back at you all the time? I understand you use banter a certain way, i do to, you should hear me on mic or in person. But in a texted based communication game you can't use the same methods. You need to be considerate in some sense and not keep pushing over domino's until you or that person get banned or quit the game.

In the end everyone here is right in some sense. Sure a one time GGEZ is okay.. and some times just slips. But there are people out there who just always do it, a personal friend of mine i stopped playing with use to do it and i can't stand him saying it for all the reasons i said in the other post. It makes even ME feel bad that it was supposedly an easy mode game. And that is enough for me to report even my friend for and stop playing with him. It is the same thing with the N word really, people say it once and think it is okay but overall it will never be okay to even once say it, which is sad yes but you need to remember the weight the term or word carries before you use it and GGEZ has that same effect but in a GAMING sense. Sure it doesn't have the history the N word has but by god it is getting close.

Look i am not attacking you, text is just hard to make it seem like you aren't attacking someone, which proves my point for ingame. So don't think i am. But you did start this, you disagreed but couldn't give a good reason for it, you kept going and still now think you are right with next to no reason for thinking that way other than "my friends do it so yeah" as a kind of ground to stand on no matter how shaky it is. 

I think the only way to get around this issue is add in game voice..

>You can sweep up 99% of the people you don't agree with or get mad at but you will still get pissed off by the 1%. I agree that the toxic people are annoying, and I guess reports are a way of dealing with them, but at the same time, please, grow a shell. It is children who get offended by things like this aswell as people who say it. People like this will always be around so while you report them you also need to change yourself and how you feel about them otherwise you will never cope.

The problem is people like you are the reason most of society as a whole are afraid to blow the whistle on bad actions. Seriously. Like take dictators or other horrible things people do, the mentality to just grow a pair of balls is freaking stupid and it is one of the things i hate about gamers and Australians mainly. Sure tell those who whinge and cry that they lost the game after first blood to grow a pair. But for people to grow a pair for doing the right thing and making the community better is freaking insane and i would love a person like you to have a perm ban from chat just because if you spew that shit and ever become popular the world would become a worse place with you influencing people to not actually stand up for what is actually wrong with the game and world.

Seriously man you should really reflect on your self if you think it is a bad thing to want punishment for horrible behavior.... Wouldn't shock me if you have been banned at some point with how hard you are fighting for people to 'grow a pair'..

Could i suggest that phrases like, gg l2p, ggez, ez game, and things a like should be automatically changed into something like "good game everyone" and various other comments. This stops people getting reported for this unsportsmanlike behaviour and also fills the chat with nicer more meaningful comments, whilst also preventing the behaviour of writing smug comments at the end of the game because they effectively can't.

Hey, I think thats a cool idea! Maybe its something fun we can put in when there is more time/resource available. Currently the main focus for most of our developers is getting the League Client update completed =D http://oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/client-update

I think it's fun solution and could be implemented for some laughs, but it's not something that can solve the root problem.

A few issues are;

1) We will never really be able to filter out all different combinations. Players are creative and put spaces inbetween or use numbers instead of letters etc etc

2) Even if we remove all combinations of gg ez and ez players that really want to write smug comments will find a different phrase to replace it

What we need to try and do is to create a sportsmanlike community and continue to show other players what good looks like and that unsportsmanlike conduct has no place in our community. (as it lowers the experience for us.). But in saying all of that, I think its a fun thing to do once in a while when there is time for it to potentially take the top used "BM" phrases and make replace them with other phrases. =D
people actually DEFENDING gg ez commenters. what a community this game has. what a world we live in

> [{quoted}](name=GigaPube,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=clgnxlgw,comment-id=0008,timestamp=2016-08-22T14:54:42.358+0000)
>
> people actually DEFENDING gg ez commenters. what a community this game has. what a world we live in

Indeed I will.
gg ez is nothing compared to "I'll rape your mother", "lmao at your baby dick" and all the other shit we have to put up with.

I don't understand why you take such offense to a couple of letters, at the end of the day whether you've had a good game or a bad one it's just a game and you can hit play again straight after. Just have fun and enjoy the game I say.... and as the saying goes sticks and stones may break my bones but words will never hurt me. 

Just saying they are only words nothing more then that :)

It's more than a game to me, its something I play for mastery, belonging and fun.
I've spent a lot of time in my life playing all sorts of sports and games for the same reason. I used to play Dota,Starcraft 2 and basketball in high school and University.

In all settings of course I have experienced both awesome sportsmanlike conduct and lame unsportsmanlike conduct. But what I can say is in most gaming communities and sports competitions sportsmanship is something to strive towards. Sportsmanship is something people care about because it ADDs to the experience of the game and the spirit of competition.

Sure gg ez is just a couple of letters, so is any abuse hurled around to be honest. But words all have meaning the only reason words and language exists is so that people can express feelings, reason, meaning to other people. You need to think of what the person that is saying gg ez is trying to get across to the opposing team. What are they trying to convey with their words. What is the meaning behind the words. More often than not as mentioned a few times in the comments here it's about rubbing salt in the wound, it's about being rude and reducing the efforts of the other team or it's a player trying to be a bit edgy and dropping it after game to feel good about themselves.

I don't think I've ever seen this kind of statement in all my life after a sports match. Every basketball game I watch I see hand shakes and hugs, every basketball game I play at the end we shake hands and say well played to the other team. 

Back in the day when I played Dota and Starcraft 2 thats when "GG" was ingrained in me, it was so awesome that we as a gaming community developed a way to "shake hands" at the end of a match to acknowledge each other. It's a shame to see that devolve into some players BMing others, and if i can help shift it towards sportsmanship i will. I want to do this because I want League of Legends to be a great experience for all our players, I  want to see it establish itself as a game that can last generations. 

(starting to ramble about my dreams for League here haha)

If we as a community don't foster a sportsmanlike community for our game it will be difficult for it to stand the test of time. In my opinion, for a game to become multi generational it needs to teach lessons that transcend the game. It needs to be more than a game, like it already is to a lot of us. It's taught me a lot about patience and how to take ownership of my mistakes. How not to blame others and how to focus on things that only I can control. (that ranked climb though). I've made friends, learnt about team work and so much more from the game. A part of any competitive game needs to have sportsmanship, it needs to help us learn what it means to be respectful to others. Humble in victory and graceful in defeat. All that jazz. Believe it or not, I've been there once. I would get sad/mad if someone flamed me all game, I would get super tilted when I lost and would flame people who say "GGEZ", I would report people for breaking the rules, and I would leave the game stressed because I fed when I did.

I had anxiety problems and started seeing a therapist, it was taking me lower and lower to the point where my self esteem got effected. It wasn't League, but I labelled League as the problem. People who pissed me off once, would get grouped together with other people who pissed me off and all my anger would be put onto them. It's not a healthy or rational way of thinking.

I eventually learned to cope and grew up thanks to my therapist, now I like to consider myself a stable person. I remember a few months ago if even that someone was mixing up AUD and USD when explaining what RP has more value in an obvious mistake when researching. I replied something like "AUD is different to USD use your head", because the OP would have been confused and the replying person make a dumb mistake, but with my fraction "use your head", I wasn't intending it negatively, it was more or less playful as to point out his mistake, I mean we live in OCE if you speak fluent English you are most likely living in NZ or Australia, if not I don't expect Indonesians or other places to be too unused to banter either.

I was mad for about a day because if you have any self management or social skills you aren't going to start crying when someone says "use your head". And it's because anxiety builds up, and you weaken your self.

People need to grow a shell if they are going to operate online on forums or in game. It is legitimately yourself getting in your own head and making things out worse than they actually are.

This is the real world. If you are upset at someone, reporting them could potentially get them punished, but it doesn't make you not upset. So if you get mad often in game, do /mute all at the start. If you can't handle arguments on online forums, don't post incorrectly structured and statements that aren't though out.

Even though I am in his presence, I have to completely disagree with Maraudaur here. Saying ggez is not toxic, people who do it (again not me) are not toxic, and do not negatively impact the game. If Riot is wasting time punishing people who say ggez instead of devoting that team to more urgent causes then there is something wrong.

We have a sportsmanlike community, most people are silent. Some people talk strategy. Some people talk banter. And then some people are jerks. People who say "ggez" fall into the 3rd category, but that's besides the point. It doesn't matter what anyone says, if you open yourself up to a random and get mad you are the one getting yourself mad.

Sure toxic people shouldn't be toxic, but it is pretty easy not to be effected by muting, or as I personally do, not caring at all. You are your own person, worrying about what a random person on the internet says about you is not emotionally healthy, especially if you play league of legends. 

In the end, people are annoying, and weaker people have the right to report or as I prefer they did mute, but they shouldn't be getting hurt in the first place, it's not cool to annoy someone. However, If you get offended or butthurt because someone says "ggez", it is 100% not that person rubbing it in on a victory. It is him having a little fun with his victory, as much as it may be BM, it is in the end banter and not meant to be taken seriously.
